Set.title: Warm up
Set.info:
”The age of a person is not measured in years – but in how flexible your spine is” - Yogi Bhajan 

Choose one, two or all of the warm up exercises to give your body a gentle warm-up.

You can choose any of the exercises and use at any time of day. 

Enjoy!

practice.title: Sufi Grind
practice.info:
Excellent warm up exercise for your lower spine.

Sit in easy pose. 

Hold your hands on your knees. Begin moving your spine in a big circle. 

Inhale as you cirle forward - lifting your heart space up and pressing your shoulder blades together.

Exhale and rotate back.

Start from left to right and continue for 1 – 3 minutes. Change directions.

This exercise warms up your lower back and stimulates your digestion.

practice.title: Spinal Flex
practice.info:
Grasp your shins with both hands. 

Inhale, stretch your spine forward. 

Exhale, let your spine flex backwards. Keeping your head level during the movement. 

On each inhale mentally vibrate the mantra “Sat,” on the exhale, mentally vibrate “Nam.” 

Time: 1 – 3 minutes.

To end: Inhale, hold briefly with the spine perfectly straight. Relax.

This exercise massages your spine and aids its flexibility. It gently massages your digestion.

practice.title: Flex your mid-spine
practice.info:
Sit in easy pose, grasp your shins with both hands. 

Inhale and flex the spine forward. 

Exhale and flex the spine back, keeping your shoulders relaxed and your head straight.

Time: 1-3 minutes. 

To end: Inhale, exhale and relax.

This exercise stimulates and stretches the lower back and mid- spine.

practice.title: Forward Stretch and hip opener
practice.info:
Stretch both legs straight out in front. 

Stretch your arms out parallel to the ground. 

Inhale and lean back with your arms stretched out. 

Exhale - lean from your hips over your legs. 

This exercise works on your spine and hips.

practice.title: Forward bend with legs spread
practice.info:
Stretch out your life!

Sit with your legs out to the sides. Lean forward and grab hold of our big toe (if possible).

If you cannot grab your big toe, just grab your ankle, shin or your knee.

Inhale and stretch up. Exhale and bend your upper body from your hips over your left leg. 

Inhale come back to the middle and stretch your back again. 

Exhale and bend over your right leg.

Remember to keep your heart open and bend from your hips. In Kundalini Yoga we often call the muscle running down the back of your legs – our life-nerve!

Time: 1 – 3 minutes.

This stretches the back of your legs, your thighs and lower back.

practice.title: Spinal Twist
practice.info:
Twist your sides and warm up your spine. 

Sit in easy posy and place your hands on your shoulders, with your fingers pointing forward and your thumb back. Your arms are parallel to the earth.

Inhale and twist your upper body to the left. 

Exhale and twist to the right. Let your head follow the movement.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes. 

This easy-to-do exercise stretches the muscles on your sides and warms up your spine. It also increases circulation in your chest and belly.

Set.title: Yoga for the Sun Energy
Set.info:
Surya Kriya - this set of yoga exercises is named after the energy of the sun. 

It brings in the energy of the sun to help you keep warm, energetic and enthusiastic. 

It also aids your digestion and helps you hold the weight down. 

Your mind will feel clear and focused afterwards.

Grab your yoga mat and get ready to shine like the sun!

practice.title: The Sun Energy set consists of 7 exercises.
1. Energy breath
practice.info:
Sit in Easy Pose with a straight spine. 

Rest your right hand on the right knee with your index finger and thumb touching. Block the left nostril with the thumb of the left hand. The other fingers point straight up. 

Begin long, deep, powerful breaths in and out of the right nostril. Focus on the flow of breath. 

Continue for 3-5 minutes. 

To end: Inhale and relax.

This exercise draws on the “sun” breath and gives you a clear, focused mind.

practice.title: 2. Sat Kriya
practice.info:
We are using the mantra “Sat Nam” in this exercise and chant it out load. 

On Sat you pull your navel in and up and on Nam relax your navel.

1) Sit on your heels in Rock Pose.
(Alternate: Rock Pose is the preferred posture but if you are unable to sit in Rock Pose, you may sit in Easy Pose or in a chair)

2) Stretch your arms above your head so that they are perfectly straight, no bend in the elbows, upper arms hugging your ears.

3) Interlace your fingers and extend your index fingers, pointing upward.

Note:

Women left thumb crossed over right.

Men: Men right thumb crossed over left.

4) Close the eyes and roll them up to the Brow Point.

5) Inhale slightly to begin.

Time: 1-3 minutes.

To end: Inhale deeply and hold the breath. Drawing in the navel, squeezing the muscles of the pelvic floor, and draw the diaphragm in. Exhale let all the air out. Again draw in your navel, squeeze the muscles of your pelvic floor and draw up your diaphragm, tuck in your cic bone. Finally, contract the lower abdominal muscles and pull the naval back toward the spine. Contracting all these muscles simultaneously is a root lock.

Repeat the exercise.

practice.title: 3. Spinal Flex
practice.info:
Grasp your shins with both hands. 

Inhale, stretch your spine forward. 

Exhale, let your spine flex backwards. Keep your head level during the movement. 

On each inhale mentally vibrate the mantra “Sat,” on the exhale, mentally vibrate “Nam.” 

On each exhale apply root lock.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes

To end. Then inhale, hold briefly with the spine perfectly straight. Relax.

This exercise massages your spine and aids its flexibility. It gently massages your digestion.

practice.title: 4. Frog Pose
practice.info:
Change gear in less than 2 minutes!

Squat with your heels together and up off the ground. Fingers are on the ground between the knees. Your head is an extension of your spine. 

Inhale, straigthen your legs, lower your head towards your knees and keep your heels off the ground. 

Exhale and come back to the original squatting position, facing forward. 

Continue 26 times. Inhale up, then relax down onto the heels.

This great exercise has many benefits:

It shapes, tones and strengthens the legs and lower body. Especially the thighs muscles.

It promotes your circulation and the flexibility of your hamstrings.

practice.title: 5. Neck Turns
practice.info:
Come sitting on your heels or in easy pose and place your hands on your thighs. 

Inhale deeply and turn the head to the left. Mentally chant “Sat.” 

Exhale completely as you turn the head to the right. Mentally chant “Nam.”

Continue inhaling and exhaling for 3 minutes.

Inhale with the head straight forward and relax.

This stimulates the circulation to the head and works on the thyroid and parathyroid glands.

practice.title: 6. Spinal Bend
practice.info:
Sit in Easy Pose. 

Place your hands on your shoulders with the fingers in front and the thumbs back. The upper arms and elbows are parallel to the ground. 

Inhale as you bend to the left. 
Exhale and bend to the right. 

Continue this swaying motion with deep breaths for 3 minutes.

This exercise flexes the spine, distributes the energy over the whole body and balances the magnetic field.

practice.title: 7. Meditate
practice.info:
Sit in a perfect meditative posture with the spine straight. 

Direct all attention through the Brow Point. Pull the Navel Point in — hold it — apply Mulbandh. Watch the flow of breath. 

On the inhale, listen to silent “Sat.” 

On the exhale, listen to silent, “Nam.” 

Continue 6 minutes or longer.

This will take you into a deep self-healing meditation.

Set.title: No Stress
Set.info: This short set of yoga exercises helps reduce stress. \n\nThe exercises work on many of the areas in the body, that have a tendency to tense up – e.g. shoulders, neck, back and the pelvis

practice.title: 1. Open your heart
practice.info:
Stretch your arms up to a 60 degree angle with the palms facing up and parallel to the floor. 

Stretch the arms all the way out.

Breathe long and deep and keep the posture.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes 

The exercises strengthens the arms and opens up the chest. After a short time your breath will automatically become long and deep.

practice.title: 2. Pelvic lifts
practice.info:
Lie on your back. 

Bend the knees with the feet flat on the ground. Grab hold of your ankles, if possible. 

Inhale, engage the navel and lift your hips up. 

Exhale down, lowering your back.

practice.title: 3. Downward Facing Dog/Triangle Pose
practice.info:
Come onto all fours. 

Place your hands with your wrists under your shoulders and your feet hip-with apart.

Press your hips towards the sky and come up into the pose. 

Checkpoints: 

Create a straight line between your wrists and your hips, and from your hips to your heels. 

The chin is pulled in, elongating the neck. 

Roll the armpits toward each other 

Do not oversway the back.

practice.title: 4. Neck Rolls
practice.info:
Sit with a straight but relaxed spine. 

Adjust your head so that you feel like it is sitting on top of the spine by slightly moving the head back and bringing the chin down slightly. 

Roll the neck slowly in one direction and then in the other. 

Let the weight of the head move the head around. 

Do this very methodically so that you go slowly through tight spots and work out areas of tension. 

At least one minute in each direction. 

To end: After this exercise, sit quietly and be with the sensations in your body and spine. 

Benefits: This exercise removes tension in the neck and stimulates the thyroid.

Set.title: Uplift your body and your spirit
Set.info: This easy set of exercises, also called Kriya for Elevation, is excellent as a warm-up and a tune-up.\n\nIt systematically exercises your whole spine and leaves you feeling balanced, uplifted and full of energy.

practice.title: Kriya for Elevation consists of 10 excercises
1. Ego Eradicator
practice.info:
Sit in easy pose. Extend your arms up to 60 degree angle, palms facing forward. 

Curl your fingertips into the pads of the palms and extend your thumbs. Angle the wrists so that the thumbs are pointing straight up and the other fingers are parallel to the ground.

Begin breath of fire or breathe long and deep.

Time: 1-3 minutes.

To end: Inhale deeply and hold the breath as you bring the thumbs together above your head. 

Exhale and apply root lock. Hold the breath out briefly. 

This exercise opens your lungs and brings the hemispheres of the brain to a state of alertness.

practice.title: 2. Spinal Flex
practice.info:
Sit in easy pose, grasp your shins with both hands. 

Inhale and flex the spine forward. 

Exhale and flex the spine back, keeping your shoulders relaxed and your head straight.

Time: 1-3 minutes. 

To end: Inhale - exhale fully and relax.

This exercise stimulates and stretches the lower back and mid- spine.

practice.title: 3. Twist
practice.info:
In easy pose, place your hands on your shoulders, arms parallel to the ground. Your thumbs back and the fingers in front.

Inhale as you twist your torso and your head the left. 

Exhale as you twist to the right.

Time: 1-3 minutes. 

To end: Inhale, facing straight forward. 

Exhale and relax.

This exercise stimulates and stretches the lower and mid-spine.

practice.title: 4. Leg stretch
practice.info:
Stretch both legs straight out in front of you. 

Grab the big toe of each foot by locking the index finger around the toe and pressing the thumb against the toenail - if you cannot reach the toes, grab your ankles.

Inhale and stretch your spine straight, pulling back on the toes and keeping the knees straight.

Exhale and bend forward from your hips. 

Continue with deep, powerful breathing for 1-3 minutes. 

To end: Inhale up and hold the breath briefly. Stay up and exhale completely, holding the breath out briefly. Inhale and relax.

This exercise works on the lower and upper spine.

practice.title: 5. One-leg stretch
practice.info:
Sit on your right heel with the left leg extended forward. Grasp the big toe of the left foot with both hands, applying a pressure against the toenail – if you cannot reach – grab hold of your shin.

Begin breath of fire or long deep breathing.

Time: 1-2 minutes.

To end: Inhale. Exhale and stretch the head and torso forward and down. Hold the breath out briefly. 

Inhale and switch legs. Repeat the exercise using the opposite side.

Relax.

This exercise helps elimination, stretches the sciatic nerve and brings circulation to the upper torso.

practice.title: 6. Wide-leg stretch
practice.info:
Spread the legs wide, grasping your toes (again if possible – do your best).

Inhale and stretch the spine straight, pulling back on the toes.

Exhale and, bending at the waist, bring the head down to the left knee.

Inhale up in the center position and exhale down, bringing up the head to the right knee.

Time: Continue with powerful breathing for 1-2 minutes.

This exercise develops flexibility of the lower spine and sacrum and charges the magnetic field.

practice.title: 7. Cobra Pose
practice.info:
Lie on the stomach with your palms flat on the floor under your shoulders. 

The heels are together with the soles of the feet facing up. 

Inhale into cobra pose, arching the spine, vertebra by vertebra, from the neck to the base of the spine until the arms are straight with the elbows locked. 

Alternatively leave your underarms on the floor in what we call Spfinx pose.

Begin breath of fire or long deep breathing.

Time: 1-3 minutes. 

To end: Inhale, arch the spine to the maximum. Exhale and hold the breath out briefly, apply the root lock and relax.

This exercise opens up the chest and reduces tension, stress and fatigue within the body. 

It strengthens and tones the back muscles and tissues along the vertebrae, therefore relieving any tension, aches and pains in the lower back.

practice.title: 8. Shoulder shrugs
practice.info:
Sit in easy pose. Place your hands on your knees. 

Inhale and pull the shoulders up toward the ears. 

Exhale and drop your shoulders down.

Time: with powerful breathing for 1-2 minutes. 

To end: Inhale. Exhale and relax.

This exercise loosens tension in the shoulders and strengthens the muscles in and around your neck.

practice.title: 9. Neck rolls
practice.info:
Sit in easy pose. 

Begin rolling your neck clockwise in a circular motion, bringing the right ear toward the right shoulder, the back of the head toward the back of the neck, the left ear toward the left shoulder and the chin toward the chest. 

The shoulders remain relaxed and motionless, and the neck should be allowed to gently stretch as the head circles around.

Time: 1 - 2 minutes, then reverse the direction and continue for 1 - 2 minutes. 

Bring the head to a central position and relax.

practice.title: 10. Sat Kriya
practice.info:
We are using the mantra “Sat Nam” in this exercise and chant it out load. 

On Sat you pull your navel in and up and on Nam relax your navel.

1) Sit on your heels in Rock Pose.
(Alternate: Rock Pose is the preferred posture but if you are unable to sit in Rock Pose, you may sit in Easy Pose or in a chair)

2) Stretch your arms above your head so that they are perfectly straight, no bend in the elbows, upper arms hugging your ears.

3) Interlace your fingers and extend your index fingers, pointing upward.

Note:

Women left thumb crossed over right.

Men: Men right thumb crossed over left.

4) Close the eyes and roll them up to the Brow Point.

5) Inhale slightly to begin.

Time: Start with 3 minutes and build up to 31 minutes.

To end: Inhale deeply and hold the breath. Drawing in the navel, squeezing the muscles of the pelvic floor, and draw the diaphragm in. Exhale let all the air out. Again draw in your navel, squeeze the muscles of your pelvic floor and draw up your diaphragm, tuck in your chin.

This exercise is used as a treatment for depression, it works on the digestion, it builds your nervous system and reproduction system and strengths your heart.

Set.title: Detox and Destress
Set.info: These simple and effective exercises deal with the effects of stress.\n\nA fantastic tune up for your adrenals and kidneys so that your body can process the effects of stress and it will leave you feeling relaxed and renewed.

practice.title: Detox and Destress consists of 12 excercises
1. Lotus Mudra
practice.info:
Sit crossed-legged in ”easy pose”. Your hands are in ”lotus” mudra – the base of your hands together, little fingers and thumbs touching and the other fingers spread apart.

Inhale and stretch the arms out to the sides, parallel to the ground with the palms facing out. Exhale, bring the hands together hitting the base of your hands together.

To end: Inhale with palms together, hold your breath and relax. Allow yourself to sit and go within.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes.

practice.title: 2. Adrenal tune-up
practice.info:
Interlace your pinkies in front of your heart, curling the other finger into the pads, thumbs sticking out. 

Lower your hands to the front of your navel. Now pull the pinkies and do ”Breath of Fire” through your mouth. 

Feel a pull across your back.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes.

This generates heat and works on one side of your adrenals.

practice.title: 3. Cannon Breath
practice.info:
Easy pose with your spine straight. 

Begin cannon breath - pucker your mouth into a firm "O" shape and breathe through the mouth, keeping your inhalation and exhalation equal, as in breath of fire. 

To end: Inhale and concentrate on your spine.

Time: 1-3 minutes.

This works on the other side on your adrenals.

practice.title: 4. Twist my arm!
practice.info:
Sitting in easy pose. 

Twist your left arm onto your back. Your left hand resting at the bottom of your ribs with your palm facing out. 

Stretch your right arm straight out, palm facing forward - hold your arm up at 60 degrees.

Keep your spine straight and stretch from your shoulder.

With your eyes open chant: Har, Har, Har powerfully from your navel. 

The word ”Har” means creative infinity.

The exercise puts pressure on your kidneys and aids detoxification.

practice.title: 5. Body drops
practice.info:
Sit in easy pose or with your legs straight out in front of you.

 Make fists of your hands and push your fists into the ground lifting your buttocks off the ground.

Should you feel any discomfort using your fists, you can place your palms flat on the floor instead.

Inhale up and exhale down.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes.

This exercise puts pressure on your kidnes and aids flushing out toxings. 

It energizes you and makes you stronger.

practice.title: 6. Cleanse
practice.info:
In easy pose place your hands in from of your navel. Your left hand facing your body, the right hand presses against your left wrist. Look down with long and powerful breathing.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes.

Let your breath go very deep. The deeper your breath the more you will cleanse.

practice.title: 7. Front Stretch and hip opener
practice.info:
Sit with your legs stretched out in front of you. Arms are parallel to the ground. 

Inhale lean back, exhale stretch from your hips over your legs.

Keep your breath powerful and your arms stretched.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes.

Challenge yourself a little with this exercise. Keep your arms straight and give your digestive systems a massage, stretch your legs out and press out through your heels, giving your legs a nice long stretch.

practice.title: 8. Pelvic lifts
practice.info:
Lie on your back, bend your knees and bring the soles of your feet towards your buttocks. 

Inhale, holding your ankles and lift your pelvis up. 

Exhale come down.

Should holding your ankles challenge you, place your palms down besides your body, inhaling up and exhaling down.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes.

This exercise tones your back, strengthens your sexualorgans and your kidneys.

practice.title: 9. Modified cat-cow.
practice.info:
Come onto all fours. 

Place your hands underneath your shoulders and your knees underneath your hips.

Exhale as you bring your knee to your forehead, inhale as you stretch the leg out and up.

Be careful not to over stretch.

Switch legs.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes.

This exercise stretches your back, tones up your core muscles and works on the co-ordination between your left and right brain hemisphere.

practice.title: 10. Kidney tonifier
practice.info:
Sit on your heels and bring your forearms to the ground in front of your knees. 

Keep your palms together. 

Inhale as you stretch over the palms, and exhale back.

Keep you chin up to create pressure on your lower back.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes.

This will put pressure on your lower back and adrenals and kidneys.

practice.title: 11. Back rolls
practice.info:
Bring the knees to your chest and breathe normally. 

Roll back and forth on your spine.

Time: 1 – 3 minutes. 

This will give your spine a gentle massage.

practice.title: 12. Totally relax
practice.info: Drink a glass of water and lie on your back with your arms besides your body, palms facing towards the heavens.\n\nListen to some relaxing music or your own breath for a while and totally relax.

practice.title: Sat Kriya (All-in-one Yoga and Meditation)
practice.info:
If I could teach only one yoga exercise, it is this.

The word “Kriya” means “completed action” – this exercise is a complete action.

This meditation is used as a treatment for depression, it works on the digestion, it builds your nervous system and reproduction system and strengths your heart.

We will use the mantra “Sat Nam” in this exercise and chant it out load. 

On Sat you pull your navel in and up and on Nam relax your navel.

1) Sit on your heels in Rock Pose. 
(Alternate: Rock Pose is the preferred posture but if you are unable to sit in Rock Pose, you may sit in Easy Pose or in a chair)

2) Stretch your arms above your head so that they are perfectly straight, no bend in the elbows, upper arms hugging your ears.

3) Interlace your fingers and extend your index fingers, pointing upward.

Note: Women left thumb crossed over right.
Men: Men right thumb crossed over left.

4) Close the eyes and roll them up to the Brow Point.

5) Inhale slightly to begin.

Time: Start with 3 minutes and build up to 31 minutes.

To end: Inhale deeply and hold the breath. Drawing in the navel, squeezing the muscles of the pelvic floor and draw the diaphragm in. 

Exhale let all the air out. Again draw in your navel, squeeze the muscles of your pelvic floor and draw up your diaphragm, tuck in your chin.

Please rest for twice as long as you have practiced.

practice.title: Mental Balance Meditation - Kirtan kriya
practice.info:
Sit straight in Easy Pose. 

Eyes: Meditate at the Brow Point. 

Mantra: Produce the five primal sounds (panj shabd): S, T, N, M, A, in the original word form: 

SAA: Infinity, cosmos, beginning 
TAA: Life, existence 
NAA: Death, change, transformation 
MAA: Rebirth 

Each repetition of the entire mantra takes 3 to 4 seconds. 

This is the cycle of Creation. From the Infinite comes life and individual existence. From life comes death or change. From death comes the rebirth of consciousnes to the joy of the Infinite through which compassion leads back to life. 

Mudra: This mantra can be done in many different mudras. Most common is to begin in Gyan Mudra. The elbows are straight while chanting, and the mudra changes as each fingertip touches in turn the tip of the thumb with firm pressure. 

On SAA, touch the first (Jupiter) finger. 

On TAA, touch the second (Saturn) finger. 

On NAA, touch the third (Sun) finger. 

On MAA, touch the fourth (Mercury) finger. 

Chant in three languages of consicousness: 

Human: normal or loud voice (the world) 
Lovers: strong whisper (longing to belong) 
Divine: mentally; silent (Infinity) 

Time: Begin the kriya in a normal voice for 5 minutes; then whisper for 5 minutes; then go deep into the sound, vibrating silently for 10 minutes. Then come back to a whisper for 5 minutes, then aloud for 5 minutes. 

The duration of the meditation may vary, as long as the proportion of loud, whisper, silent, whisper, loud is maintained. 

To End: This sequence will take 30 minutes. Follow with one 1 minute of stretching the arms over your head and spreading the fingers wide, shaking them out, circulating the energy, inhaling and exhaling 3 times.

Relax.

practice.title: The cappucino meditation - Powerful energy
practice.info:
Sit in Easy Pose with a straight spine. 

Interlock all of your fingers except your ring fingers, which are pressed together pointing upward. 

The right thumb locks down the left thumb. 

Place the mudra at diaphragm level, several inches out from the body, with the fingers pointing out at a sixty-degree angle. 

Close your eyes.

Inhale deeply and chant "Ong" in long form, one recitation of "Ong" per exhalation. 

The sound is created through the nose; although the mouth is held slightly open, no air comes through the mouth. 

The sound comes from the nose by way of the back of the upper palate. Your upper palate will vibrate, concentrate to do it correctly. 

Time: Repeat minimum 5 times.

practice.title: Inner peace and balance - For a calm heart
practice.info:
Sit in an Easy Pose. 

EYES: Either close the eyes or look straight ahead with the eyes 1/10th open. 

MUDRA: Place the left hand on the center of the chest at the Heart Center. 

The palm is flat against your chest, and the fingers are parallel to the ground, pointing to the right. 

Touch the tip of your index finger with the tip of your thumb. 

Raise the right hand up to the right side as if giving a pledge. 

Your palm faces forward, the three fingers other fingers point up. The elbow is relaxed near the side with the forearm perpendicular to the ground. 

Breath: Concentrate on the flow of the breath. Inhale slowly and deeply through both nostrils. 

Then suspend the breath in and raise the chest. 

Exhale smoothly, gradually and completely. When the breath is totally out, lock the breath out for as long as possible. 

Time: 3-31 minutes. 

To End: Inhale and exhale strongly 3 times. 

Relax.

practice.title: Get started
practice.info:
This app is designed both for you, who are new to yoga and the experienced yogi.

With this app you get 39 yoga exercises divided into 5 yoga sessions. 

Examples are Anti-stress, Energy and Detox. 

Furthermore you get 4 meditations to choose from.

The poses are easy and convenient to do. - where and when it suits you, on a chair, at work or on your living room floor.

All yoga sets have been picked with special attention to balancing and revitalizing your body and nervous system. Select the exercises you need today

Start with "Tune in" (located under Get Started)

"Warm up" choose the ones you need today (located under Yoga)

Yoga: Select the sequence that appeals to you today (located under Yoga)

End your yoga with "To end a Kundalini Yoga class" (located under Get Started)

practice.title: Tune in
practice.info:
In Kundalini Yoga we tune in with the mantra: ONG NAMO GURU DEV NAMO.The mantra means: I bow to the Creative Wisdom, I bow to the Divine Teacher within. 

Everything in the universe is made of energy, vibrating at various frequencies. 

Chanting mantras is not singing or speaking, it is vibrating. Mantras are combinations of syllables that allow us to connect with specific levels of consciousness, affecting the patterns of the mind and chemistry of the brain. 

How to tune in: Sit with your spine straight, preferably cross-legged on the floor. Pull your chin back slightly. Place the palms of the hands together at the centre of the chest, fingers pointing upward, thumbs lightly pressing on the sternum. 

Close your eyes and keep your focus at the centre of your forehead. Take a few long deep breaths through the nose. 

Chant ONG NAMO GURU DEV NAMO at least three times or as many times as you wish until you feel ‘connected.

practice.title: To end a Kundalini Yoga class
practice.info:
Each Kundalini Yoga class ends by chanting SAT NAM three times. 

The SAT is chanted seven times longer than the NAM.

SAT means 'truth' and NAM means 'identity' - we end the class with the consciousness of being our true identity
